com.ikalagaming.permissions

Class Permission

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ikalagaming.permissions.Permission

  • public class Permission
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a unique permission.
    Author:
    Ches Burks

    • Constructor Detail

      • Permission

        public Permission(java.lang.String name)

        Constructs a new permission with a name. The description defaults to an empty string. The default value defaults to the default for permissions. The children list defaults to empty.

        The name is a string that identifies the permission, and is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the permission
        See Also:
        Permission(String, String, boolean, Map)

      • Permission

        public Permission(java.lang.String name,
          boolean defaultValue)

        Constructs a new permission with a name and default value. The description defaults to an empty string. The children list defaults to empty.

        The name is a string that identifies the permission, and is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"

        The default value is a value that determines the default for this permission.
        Example: "false"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the permission
        defaultValue - the default value for the permission
        See Also:
        Permission(String, String, boolean, Map)

      • Permission

        public Permission(java.lang.String name,
          boolean defaultValue,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> children)

        Constructs a new permission with a name, default value, and children list. The description defaults to an empty string.

        The name is a string that identifies the permission, and is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"

        The default value is a value that determines the default for this permission.
        Example: "false"

        The children is a list of permissions that are granted or revoked when this permission is granted/revoked. Each child permission has a boolean assigned to it. If the boolean is true, the child permission will inherit this permissions value. If it is false, it will inherit the inverse of this permissions value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the permission
        defaultValue - the default value for the permission
        children - children this permission includes
        See Also:
        Permission(String, String, boolean, Map)

      • Permission

        public Permission(java.lang.String name,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> children)

        Constructs a new permission with a name, and children list. The default value defaults to the default for permissions. The description defaults to an empty string.

        The name is a string that identifies the permission, and is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"

        The children is a list of permissions that are granted or revoked when this permission is granted/revoked. Each child permission has a boolean assigned to it. If the boolean is true, the child permission will inherit this permissions value. If it is false, it will inherit the inverse of this permissions value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the permission
        children - children this permission includes
        See Also:
        Permission(String, String, boolean, Map)

      • Permission

        public Permission(java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String description)

        Constructs a new permission with a name and description. The default value defaults to the default for permissions. The children list defaults to empty.

        The name is a string that identifies the permission, and is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"

        The description is a short description of what the permission is for.
        Example: "This allows entities to move around the world"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the permission
        description - A short description of the permissions purpose
        See Also:
        Permission(String, String, boolean, Map)

      • Permission

        public Permission(java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String description,
          boolean defaultValue)

        Constructs a new permission with a name, description, and default value. The children list defaults to empty.

        The name is a string that identifies the permission, and is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"

        The description is a short description of what the permission is for.
        Example: "This allows entities to move around the world"

        The default value is a value that determines the default for this permission.
        Example: "false"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the permission
        description - A short description of the permissions purpose
        defaultValue - the default value for the permission
        See Also:
        Permission(String, String, boolean, Map)

      • Permission

        public Permission(java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String description,
          boolean defaultValue,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> children)

        Constructs a new permission with a name, description, default value, and children list.

        The name is a string that identifies the permission, and is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"

        The description is a short description of what the permission is for.
        Example: "This allows entities to move around the world"

        The default value is a value that determines the default for this permission.
        Example: "false"

        The children is a list of permissions that are granted or revoked when this permission is granted/revoked. Each child permission has a boolean assigned to it. If the boolean is true, the child permission will inherit this permissions value. If it is false, it will inherit the inverse of this permissions value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the permission
        description - A short description of the permissions purpose
        defaultValue - the default value for the permission
        children - children this permission includes

      • Permission

        public Permission(java.lang.String name,
          java.lang.String description,
          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> children)

        Constructs a new permission with a name, description, and children list. The default value defaults to the default for permissions.

        The name is a string that identifies the permission, and is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"

        The description is a short description of what the permission is for.
        Example: "This allows entities to move around the world"

        The children is a list of permissions that are granted or revoked when this permission is granted/revoked. Each child permission has a boolean assigned to it. If the boolean is true, the child permission will inherit this permissions value. If it is false, it will inherit the inverse of this permissions value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"

        Parameters:
        name - The name of the permission
        description - A short description of the permissions purpose
        children - children this permission includes
        See Also:
        Permission(String, String, boolean, Map)

    • Method Detail

      • exists

        public static boolean exists(java.lang.String permissionName)
        Checks to see if a permission with the given name has already been created. If it exists, this returns true.
        Parameters:
        permissionName - the fully qualified permission name
        Returns:
        true if the permission exists

      • getByName

        public static Permission getByName(java.lang.String permissionName)
        If the permission named already exists, returns that permission. Returns null if the permission does not already exist.
        Parameters:
        permissionName - the fully qualified permission name
        Returns:
        the permission with the given name, if it exists

      • loadPermission

        public static Permission loadPermission(java.lang.String name,
                        java.util.Map<?,?> data,
                        boolean def,
                        java.util.List<Permission> output)
                                 throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                                        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Loads a Permission from a map, usually used from retrieval from a yaml file.

        The data may contain the following keys:

        • default: Boolean true or false. If not specified, false.
        • children: Map(String, Boolean) of child permissions. If not specified, empty list.
        • description: Short string containing a very small description of this permission. If not specified, empty string.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the permission
        data - Map of keys to load from
        def - Default permission value to use if not set
        output - A list to append any created child-Permissions to. This may be null
        Returns:
        Permission the permissions object
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the name or data provided is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the permissions had invalid data

      • loadPermission

        public static Permission loadPermission(java.lang.String name,
                        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> data)
        Loads a Permission from a map, usually used from retrieval from a yaml file.

        The data may contain the following keys:

        • default: Boolean true or false. If not specified, false.
        • children: Map(String, Boolean) of child permissions. If not specified, empty list.
        • description: Short string containing a very small description of this description. If not specified, empty string.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the permission
        data - Map of keys
        Returns:
        Permission the permissions object

      • loadPermissions

        public static java.util.List<Permission> loadPermissions(java.util.Map<?,?> data,
                                         java.lang.String error,
                                         boolean defaultPerm)
        Loads a list of Permissions from a map, usually used from retrieval from a yaml file.

        The data may contain a list of name:data, where the data contains the following keys:

        • default: Boolean true or false. If not specified, false.
        • children: Map(String, Boolean) of child permissions. If not specified, empty list.
        • description: Short string containing a very small description of this description. If not specified, empty string.
        Parameters:
        data - Map of permissions
        error - An error message to show if a permission is invalid.
        defaultPerm - Default permission value to use if missing
        Returns:
        Permission object

      • getChildPermissions

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> getChildPermissions()
        Returns the children is a list of permissions that are granted or revoked when this permission is granted/revoked. Each child permission has a boolean assigned to it. If the boolean is true, the child permission will inherit this permissions value. If it is false, it will inherit the inverse of this permissions value.
        Example: "entity.jump" is mapped to "true"
        Returns:
        the list of child permissions

      • getAllSubpermissions

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Boolean> getAllSubpermissions()
        Returns a complete list of permissions this permission grants or revokes. It recursively finds all subpermissions, with parents overriding child permissions.
        Returns:
        the full list of child permissions
        See Also:
        getChildPermissions()

      • contains

        public boolean contains(Permission other)
        Returns true if the permission or one of the subpermissions contains the given permission. If the permission is the same as this one, it returns true as well.
        Parameters:
        other - the permission to search for
        Returns:
        true if this permission contains or equals the given permission

      • getDefault

        public boolean getDefault()
        Returns the default for this permission.
        Example: "false"
        Returns:
        default value of this permission.

      • getDescription

        public java.lang.String getDescription()
        Returns a short description of the purpose for the permission, if it is set. Returns an empty string if it is not set.
        Example: "This allows entities to move around the world"
        Returns:
        Brief description of this permission

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Returns the name that identifies the permission, which is the same string as would be found in permission yaml files.
        Example: "entity.movement"
        Returns:
        fully qualified name for this permission

      • setDefault

        public void setDefault(DefaultPermissionValue value)
        Sets the default value of this permission.

        This will not be saved to disk, and is a temporary operation until the server reloads permissions. Changing this default will cause all PermissionHolders that contain this permission to recalculate their permissions

        Parameters:
        value - The new default to set
